title: Body
description: A planet or body to generate

starSystem.description: Unique star system containing your planet

destroy.description: True if you want to delete this planet

hasMapMarker.description: If the body should have a marker on the map screen.

hasAmbientLight.description: If the dark side of the body should have some slight ammount of light

surfaceGravity.description: The acceleration due to gravity felt as the surfaceSize. Timber Hearth has 12 for reference

gravityFallOff.description: How gravity falls off with distance. Most planets use linear but the sun and some moons use inverseSquared.

surfaceSize.description: A scale height used for a number of things. Should be the approximate radius of the body.

sphereOfInfluence.description: An override for the radius of the planet's gravitational sphere of influence. Optional

groundSize.description: Radius of the a simple sphere used as the ground for the planet. If you want to use more complex terrain, leave this as 0.

hasCometTail.description: If you want the body to have a tail like the Interloper.

hasReferenceFrame.description: Allows the object to be targeted on the map.

centerOfSolarSystem.description: Set this to true if you are replacing the sun with a different body. Only one object in a star system should ever have this set to true.

isSatellite.description: Is this body an artificial satellite of a planet/moon/star?

cloudTint.description: Colour of the cloud layer. Only relevant if "cloud" has a value

cloud.description: Relative filepath to the cloud texture, if the planet has clouds.

cloudCap.description: Relative filepath to the cloud cap texture, if the planet has clouds.

cloudRamp.description: Relative filepath to the cloud ramp texture, if the planet has clouds. If you don't put anything here it will be auto-generated.

useBasicCloudShader.description: Set to false to use Giant's deep shader. Set to true to just apply the cloud texture as is.

shadowsOnClouds.description: If the top layer should have shadows. Set to false if you're making a brown dwarf.

fogTint.description: Colour of fog on the planet, if you put fog.

fogDensity.description: How dense the fog is, if you put fog.

fogSize.description: Radius of fog sphere, independent of the atmosphere. This has to be set for there to be fog.

hasOxygen.description: Lets you survive on the planet without a suit.

hasAtmosphere.description: Whether we use an atmospheric shader on the planet. Doesn't affect clouds, fog, rain, snow, oxygen, etc. Purely visual.

atmosphereTint.description: Colour of atmospheric shader on the planet.

semiMajorAxis.description: The semi-major axis of the ellipse that is the body's orbit. For a circular orbit this is the radius.

inclination.description: The angle (in degrees) between the body's orbit and the plane of the star system

primaryBody.description: The name of the body this one will orbit around

isMoon.description: Is this the moon of a planet? Used for determining when its name is shown on the map.

longitudeOfAscendingNode.description: An angle (in degrees) defining the point where the orbit of the body rises above the orbital plane if it has nonzero inclination.

eccentricity.description: At 0 the orbit is a circle. The closer to 1 it is, the more oval-shaped the orbit is.

argumentOfPeriapsis.description: An angle (in degrees) defining the location of the periapsis (closest distance to it's primary body) if it has nonzero eccentricity.

trueAnomaly.description: Where the planet should start off in its orbit in terms of the central angle.

axialTilt.description: The angle between the normal to the orbital plane and its axis of rotation.

isTidallyLocked.description: Should the body always have one side facing its primary?

showOrbitLine.description: Referring to the orbit line in the map screen.

isStatic.description: Is the body meant to stay in one place without moving?

tint.description: Colour of the orbit-line in the map view.

trackingOrbitLine.description: Should we just draw a line behind its orbit instead of the entire circle/ellipse?

inclination.description: Angle between the rings and the equatorial plane of the planet.

longitudeOfAscendingNode.description: Angle defining the point where the rings rise up from the planet's equatorial plane if inclination is nonzero.

texture.description: Relative filepath to the texture used for the rings.

curve.description: Allows the rings to grow/shrink with time.

heightMap.description: Relative filepath to the texture used for the terrain height

textureMap.description: Relative filepath to the texture used for the terrain.

minHeight.description: The lowest points on your planet will be at this height.

maxHeight.description: The highest points on your planet will be at this height.

inclination.description: Angle between the rings and the equatorial plane of the planet.

longitudeOfAscendingNode.description: Angle defining the point where the rings rise up from the planet's equatorial plane if inclination is nonzero.

randomSeed.description: Number used to randomize asteroid positions

solarFlareTint.description: Colour of the solar flares. The shader is a bit weird so the value you put won't exactly reflect what you see. Try experimenting with different colours to see what works.

lightTint.description: Colour of the light given off.

solarLuminosity.description: Relative strength of the light compared to the sun

hasAtmosphere.description: The default sun has its own atmosphere that is different from regular planets. If you want that, set this to true.

curve.description: Allows the star to shrink/grow over time.

FocalPoint.description: Use this to create the focal point that two objects can orbit in a binary system

primary.description: The larger of the two bodies in the binary pair.

secondary.description: The smaller of the two bodies in the binary pair.

path.description: Either the path in the scene hierarchy of the item to copy or the path to the object in the supplied asset bundle

scale.description: How many props to scatter around the planet.

path.description: Either the path in the scene hierarchy of the item to copy or the path to the object in the supplied asset bundle

alignToNormal.description: Do we override rotation and try to automatically align this object to stand upright on the body's surface?

position.description: When you enter into dialogue, you will look here.

radius.description: Radius of the spherical collision volume where you get the "talk to" prompt when looking at. If you use a remoteTriggerPosition, this will instead be the size of the volume that will trigger the dialogue when you enter it.

xmlFile.description: Relative path to the xml file defining the dialogue.

remoteTriggerPosition.description: Allows you to trigger dialogue from a distance when you walk into an area.

reveal.description: A set of volumes that reveal ship log fact

revealOn.description: 'enter', 'observe', or 'snapshot' what needs to be done to the volume to unlock the facts

reveals.description: A list of facts to reveal

position.description: The position to place the volume at

maxDistance.description: The max distance the user can be away from the volume to reveal the fact (snapshot and observe only)

maxAngle.description: The max view angle (in degrees) the player can see the volume with to unlock the fact

entryLocation.description: A set of locations for ship log entries

id.description: The ID of the entry this location is for

cloaked.description: Whether this entry location is in a cloaking field

position.description: The position of this entry location

playerSpawnPoint.description: If you want the player to spawn on the new body, set a value for this. Press "P" in game with Debug mode on to have the game log the position you're looking at to find a good value for this.

startWithSuit.description: If you spawn on a planet with no oxygen, you probably want to set this to true ;)

frequency.description: The frequency ID of the signal. The built-in game values are "Default", "Traveler", "Quantum", "EscapePod", "Statue", "WarpCore", "HideAndSeek", and "Radio". You can also put a custom value.

name.description: The unique ID of the signal.

audioClip.description: Name of an existing AudioClip in the game that will player over the signal.

audioFilePath.description: Relative filepath to the .wav file to use as the audio. Mutually exclusive with audioClip

reveals.description: A ship log fact to reveal when the signal is identified

sourceRadius.description: Radius of the sphere giving off the signal

detectionRadius.description: How close the player must get to the signal to detect it. This is when you get the "Unknown Signal Detected" notification.

identificationRadius.description: How close the player must get to the signal to identify it. This is when you learn it's name.

onlyAudibleToScope.description: False if the player can hear the signal without equipping the signal-scope.

insideCloak.description: Only set to true if you are putting this signal inside a cloaking field.

size.description: Radius of the singularity. Note that this isn't the same as the event horizon, but includes the entire volume that has warped effects in it.

pairedSingularity.description: The name of the white hole or black hole that is paired to this one. If you don't set a value, entering will kill the player

targetStarSystem.description: If you want a black hole to load a new star system scene, put it's name here. Optional.

target.description: The body that the funnel is pouring onto

xmlFile.description: The relative path to the xml file to load ship log entries from.

spriteFolder.description: A path to the folder where entry sprites are stored.

initialReveal.description: A list of fact IDs to reveal when the game starts.

entryPositions.description: A set of positions to use instead of automatic layout in rumor mode.

id.description: The name of the entry to apply the position to.

revealedSprite.description: The path to the sprite to show when the planet is revealed in map mode.

outlineSprite.description: The path to the sprite to show when the planet is unexplored in map mode.

manualPosition.description: Manually place this planet at the specified position.

manualNavigationPosition.description: Specify where this planet is in terms of navigation.

scale.description: Scale to apply to the planet in map mode.

invisibleWhenHidden.description: Hide the planet completely if unexplored instead of showing an outline.

offset.description: Extra distance to apply to this object in map mode.

remove.description: Completely remove this planet (and it's children) from map mode.

details.description: Place non-selectable object in map mode (like sand funnels).

revealedSprite.description: The sprite to show when the parent AstroBody is revealed.

outlineSprite.description: The sprite to show when the parent AstroBody is rumored/unexplored.

rotation.description: The angle in degrees to rotate the detail.

invisibleWhenHidden.description: Whether to completely hide this detail when the parent AstroBody is unexplored.

position.description: The position (relative to the parent) to place the detail.

scale.description: The amount to scale the x and y axis of the detail by.

Curiosities.description: A set of colors to apply to curiosities.

id.description: The ID of the curiosity to apply the color to.

color.description: The color to apply to entries with this curiosity.

highlightColor.description: The color to apply to highlighted entries with this curiosity.
